title: ICE: 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: concrete_substs.is_normalized_for_trans()'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
The ICE goes away if `&str` is changed to `()` so it might have something to do with lifetimes.

``` rust
pub trait StreamOnce {
    type Position;
}

impl<'a> StreamOnce for &'a str {
    type Position = usize;
}

pub fn parser<F>(_: F) {
    panic!()
}

fn follow(_: &str) -> <&str as StreamOnce>::Position {
    panic!()
}

fn main() {
    parser(follow);
}
```

